currentDoc:
Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to priortize them to reduce the most suffereing

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. I think the conditon

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions o

They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not sepera

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not seperate so when one is doing well the other i

However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Animals

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Animals have also been bread over the year

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eye

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. We look at a puppy and part of us unconsiously thinks of a young child. W

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. We look at a puppy and part of us unconsciously thinks of a young child. We then want to nurture and protect it. This is one of the main reasons we are so overly empathetic to the suffering of our pets but not so much animals in h

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. We look at a puppy and part of us unconsciously thinks of a young child. We then want to nurture and protect it. This is one of the main reasons we are so overly empathetic to the suffering of our pets but not so much animals in the wild. We need a compre

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. This is one of the main reasons we are so overly empathetic to the suffering of our pets but not so much animals in the wild. We need a comprehensive plan to increase the well being of both humans and animals.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. We look at a puppy and part of us unconsciously thinks of a young child. We then want to nurture and protect it. This is one of the main reasons we are so overly empathetic to the suffering of our pets but not so much animals in the wild. We need a comprehensive plan to increase the well being of both humans and animals. A healthy human civilization could end up saving many more animals te

However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. We look at a puppy and part of us unconsciously thinks of a young child. We then want to nurture and protect it. This is one of the main reasons we are so overly empathetic to the suffering of our pets but not so much animals in the wild. We need a comprehensive plan to increase the well being of both humans and animals. A healthy human civilization could end up saving many more animals then it uses if we, our

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. We look at a puppy and part of us unconsciously thinks of a young child. We then want to nurture and protect it. This is one of the main reasons we are so overly empathetic to the suffering of our pets but not so much animals in the wild. We need a comprehensive plan to increase the well being of both humans and animals. A healthy human civilization could end up saving many more animals then it uses if we, ourselves can get our act together. So while I hav

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. We look at a puppy and part of us unconsciously thinks of a young child. We then want to nurture and protect it. This is one of the main reasons we are so overly empathetic to the suffering of our pets but not so much animals in the wild. We need a comprehensive plan to increase the well being of both humans and animals. A healthy human civilization could end up saving many more animals then it uses if we, ourselves can get our act together. Choos

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In my opinion, people personify pets, they anthropomorphize them. So dogs and cats might as well be a person with a history, personality, and relationships. They are considered part of the family so I do understand why people would choose their pets 40 percent of the time over a strangers life. However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. We look at a puppy and part of us unconsciously thinks of a young child. We then want to nurture and protect it. This is one of the main reasons we are so overly empathetic to the suffering of our pets but not so much animals in the wild. We need a comprehensive plan to increase the well being of both humans and animals. A healthy human civilization could end up saving many more animals then it uses if we, ourselves can get our act together. Choosing between the two would be an illu

However, we have the financial capacity and the capacity to care enough about both issues. This should not be an either or, it should be a both. The world is both full of people problems and animal problems. We need to prioritize them to reduce the most suffering on both sides. The conditions of people and animals are not separate so when one is doing well the other is usually doing well. Pets have also been bread over the years to get cuter and for humans that means resemble children with their big round eyes and small facial features. We look at a puppy and part of us unconsciously thinks of a young child. We then want to nurture and protect it. This is one of the main reasons we are so overly empathetic to the suffering of our pets but not so much animals in the wild. We need a comprehensive plan to increase the well being of both humans and animals. A healthy human civilization could end up saving many more animals then it uses if we, ourselves can get our act together. Choosing between the two would be an reckless at best. W

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?
